page.title: 03FARMING CROPS LIVESTOCK LAND
page.content: {CROPS:}The main crop grown in our area is barley. Other crops grown locally are wheat, oats, potatoes, turnips and grass. Crops like protein peas and oil seed rape have been grown as new crops to this area. {LIVESTOCK:}The main animals are sheep and cattle. The most common breeds of sheep are cheviot or greyface crosses. The cattle are a mixture ranging from Aberdeen Angus to the Fresian Hereford cross. The cattle and sheep go to the markets in Rogart, Lairg and Dingwall to be sold. {LAND:}The ground in our block is well drained apart from the areas below sea level. The cultivated areas near the sea have soft and sandy soils. Common grazing on the Links is available to the tennants of Littletown. For a fee they can graze a tethered horse, a cow and a calf on the Dornoch Links.
